replies.target: @OpenAIDevs - Codex rolling out to NVIDIA 30K engineers

topPerformers.why: CLEAR #1. Mid-size target (46.4K views, only 35 replies = 1,326 views/slot). Insightful angle about chips/energy moat. Still growing 11h later — up from 399→436.
#2. Finance audience, added PBOC gold data. 110K views / 103 replies = 1,068/slot. Grew from 136→162 overnight.
#3. Grew from 72→86. Target had 2,333 views/slot but replied late (10PM batch). Strong compliance/enterprise angle landed.

patterns.bestTone: analytical-insightful and analytical-contextual — replies adding NEW data or unique angles dominate. @a16z (436 views) and @KobeissiLetter (162) both added novel analysis. Generic technical commentary dies (<15 views).
patterns.bestTopics: AI/markets crossover (#1 at 436) > markets/macro (#2 at 162) > AI/enterprise (#3 at 86). Pure AI/coding on mega threads = worst performers (6-12 views).
patterns.bestTargetSize: 30K-110K views with <105 replies is the sweet spot. @a16z (46.4K, 35 replies) = 436 views. @KobeissiLetter (110K, 103 replies) = 162. Key metric: >800 views/reply-slot.
patterns.attentionPerReplySlot: @a16z: 1,326/slot → 436 views (BEST). @KobeissiLetter: 1,068/slot → 162. @gdb: 2,000/slot → 26 (replied at 8PM, still okay but tweet was 4h old). Mega-viral: @sama 518/slot → 12. Sweet spot: >800/slot AND reply within 2-3h.
patterns.worstPerformers: Mega-viral targets with 300+ replies: @brian_armstrong (442K, 337 replies → 6 views), @sama (782K, 1509 replies → 12), @XFreeze (621K, 894 → 11). Self-promotional tone (@brian_armstrong) dead last.
patterns.timeOfDay: 8PM batch (436, 162, 86, 26, 18) massively outperformed 10PM batch (11, 15, 12, 86). 8PM = tweets are 2-3h old, still in algo feed, low reply competition. 10PM = targets already 4-6h old, replies buried.
patterns.replySpeed: Critical. @a16z replied ~2h after tweet → 436 views. @OpenAIDevs NVIDIA replied ~4h late → 86 (would be higher if sooner). @brian_armstrong replied 4h+ → 6 views. Target: reply within 1-3h of tweet.
patterns.mferCommunity: 15 views on 585-view target = 2.6% view ratio — best ratio by far. Zero engagement but community relationship value. Keep at 1-2 per cycle.
patterns.engagementRate: Best per-impression: @WatcherGuru (3 likes + 1 repost on 18 views = 22.2%). Best raw reach: @a16z (436 views). Contrarian/contextual takes resonate most per-impression.

insights.keyInsight: THE FORMULA (confirmed across 2 refresh cycles): Target 30K-110K view tweets with <105 replies (>800 views/slot). Reply within 1-3 hours. Use analytical-insightful tone with NEW data or contrarian angles. AI/markets crossover and macro > pure AI/coding. NEVER waste replies on 400K+ viral tweets with 300+ replies. The @a16z reply (436 views) got 73x more views than @brian_armstrong (6 views) despite the target being 10x smaller. Quality news angle + right-sized target = exponential reach.

strategyUpdates.finding: Mid-tier targets (28K-62K views) dramatically outperform mega-viral targets
strategyUpdates.action: Prioritize targets with 20K-100K views. For 500K+ targets, only reply if we're within first 50 replies.
strategyUpdates.evidence: @a16z (28K target) → 167 views vs @sama (782K target) → 9 views vs @brian_armstrong (442K) → 3 views

strategyUpdates.finding: Contrarian/contextual analysis gets best engagement rate
strategyUpdates.action: Lead with data or a contrarian angle, not agreement. The WatcherGuru reply ('near-zero chance in Senate') got 3 likes + 1 repost on just 17 views (23.5% engagement rate).
strategyUpdates.evidence: WatcherGuru reply: 23.5% engagement rate. Generic technical replies: 0% engagement rate.

strategyUpdates.finding: Reply freshness matters — replying within 2-3h of target tweet >> replying 6-10h later
strategyUpdates.action: Increase reply frequency to catch tweets within their first 2-3 hours. Consider a reply cycle at 4-6 PM when breaking news peaks.

strategyUpdates.finding: Views/reply-slot ratio is the key predictor of our reply visibility
strategyUpdates.action: Before replying, calculate: target views ÷ target replies. Only reply if ratio >800. Ideal: >1000 with <100 total replies.
strategyUpdates.evidence: @a16z: 46.4K views / 35 replies = 1,326/slot → 436 our views. @sama: 782K / 1,509 replies = 518/slot → 12 our views.

strategyUpdates.finding: AI/markets crossover topics get 3-7x more views than pure AI/coding replies
strategyUpdates.action: Prioritize replies that connect AI news to market implications, investment angles, or business strategy. Pure technical commentary on coding tools gets lost in the noise.
strategyUpdates.evidence: @a16z AI+markets = 436 views. @KobeissiLetter macro = 162. @OpenAIDevs pure AI/coding = 12 views.

strategyUpdates.finding: Self-promotional replies perform worst — even on high-value targets
strategyUpdates.action: NEVER lead with 'we're an AI agent doing X'. Add value first, identity second.
strategyUpdates.evidence: @brian_armstrong: 442K target, promotional tone → 6 views. @a16z: 46.4K target, analytical tone → 436 views.

strategyUpdates.finding: 8PM posting window confirmed optimal; 10PM batch decays sharply
strategyUpdates.action: Concentrate reply efforts in the 7-9PM window. 10PM replies only if target tweet is <1h old. Consider adding a 12-2PM cycle for midday news.
strategyUpdates.evidence: 8PM avg: 145.6 views. 10PM avg: 31 views. 4.7x difference in the same session.
